newsitem.title: ITALY: Transport strike halts storm-hit north Italy.
newsitem.headline: Transport strike halts storm-hit north Italy.

text.p: A strike by bus, tram and commuter train workers brought traffic chaos to northern Italy on Wednesday, adding to problems caused by two days of torrential rain.
Union leaders said they called the stoppage to demand a renewal of workers' contracts which expired around nine months ago and to demand reform to the local transport system.

The eight-hour strike hit almost all of northern Italy. But it was called off in the town of Reggio Emilia after a moderate earthquake on Tuesday in which two people died and buildings were slightly damaged. The town was near the epicentre.
Transport workers were due to strike in central Italy on Thursday, except in Rome where the strike was put off until next Tuesday after an appeal by mayor Francesco Rutelli.
He feared that transport chaos would paint a poor picture of the city for visiting International Olympic Committee officials looking at Rome's bid to host the 2004 Summer Games.
The stoppage was due to spread to southern Italy on Friday ahead of a national strike on October 25.
